page.title: 01EPCOMBES (HISTORIC HOUSE)
page.content: EPCOMBES Epcombes was built in the reign of Elizebeth the 1.It was a simple sqaure with two storeys.Each room led to another.That's why they used to have four poster beds with curtains round,so you would not be disturbed. During 1702-1714 more was added on all the way round the original house,so that now,from the outside you could not see any of the original house.Even more was added on in 1900.Although there was a building on the same spot marked in the Domesday Book Epcombes is a different one.The house is built of brick and the roof of slate.The house slopes so it makes it hard to put furniture in without it leaning. Also the windows are crooked,so the curtains had to be cut.In the whole house there are nine bedrooms.There is no cellar in Epcombes.They used to....
